alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 2:54AM MST until January 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Visibility down to under a half mile at times. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph in wind prone areas. Gusts to 40 mph in the Laramie Valley to include Laramie as well as central Laramie County to include Cheyenne. * WHERE...Wind prone areas of southeast Wyoming to include Arlington...the Interstate 80 Summit and eastern foothills... as well as Bordeaux on Interstate 25. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
